gurmukhi: ਬਿਅਾਕਲ ਸਕਲ ਦੇਵਤਾ ਭੲੇ || ਮਿਲਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਭੁ ਬਾਸਵ ਪੈ ਗੲੇ ||
transliteration: Biaakal Sakal Devtaa Bhae|| Mil(i)||kar(i) Sabh(u) Baasav Pai Gad||
translation: Realising this all the gods were worried and went to Indra and said:

gurmukhi: ਛੱਤ੍ਰੀ ਰੂਪ ਧਰੇ ਸਭੁ ਅਸੁਰਨ || ਅਾਵਤ ਕਹਾ ਭੂਪ ਤੁਮਰੇ ਮਨ ||੨||
transliteration: Chhattriroop Ddare Sabh(u) Asuran|| Aavatg Kahaa Bhoop Toumre Man2||
translation: “All the demons have transformed themselves as Kshatriyas, O King ! Now tell us your view about it.”2.

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਦੇਵਨ ਮਿਲਿ ਕਰਯੋ ਬਿਚਾਰਾ || ਛੀਰ ਸਮੁੰਦ੍ਰ ਕਹੁ ਚਲੇ ਸੁਧਾਰਾ ||
transliteration: Sabh Devan Mil(i) Daryo Bichaaraa|| Chheer Samounndra Kauh Chale Sudhaaraa||
translation: All the gods together reflected on this issued and went towards the milk-ocean.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਲ ਪੁਰਖ ਕੀ ਕਰੀ ਬਡਾੲੀ || ੲਿਮ ਅਾਗਿਅਾ ਤਹ ਤੇ ਤਿਨ ਅਾੲੀ ||੩||
transliteration: Kaal Purakh Kikaribadaaee|| Im Aagiaa Tah Te Tin Aaee||3||
translation: There they eulogized KAL, the destroyer Lord and received the following message.3.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਜ ਜਮਦਗਨ ਜਗਤ ਮੋ ਸੋਹਤ || ਨਿਤ ੳੁਠਿ ਕਰਤ ਅਘਨ ਓਘਨ ਹਤ ||
transliteration: Dij Jamdagad Jagad Mo Shoat|| Nit Outh(i) Karat Aghan Oghan Hat||
translation: The Destroyer Lord said, “ A sage named Yamadagni abides on the earth, who always gets up to destroy the sins by his virtuous deeds.

gurmukhi: ਤਹ ਤੁਮ ਧਰੋ ਬਿਸਨ ਅਵਤਾਰਾ || ਹਨਹੁ ਸੱਕ੍ਰ ਦੇ ਸੱਤ੍ਰੁ ਸੁਧਾਰਾ ||੪||
transliteration: Tah Toum Ddaro Bisan Avtaaraa|| Hanoh Sakkra De Sattr(u) Sudhaaraa||4||
translation: “O Vishnu, manifested yourself in his house and destroy the enemies of India.”4.

gurmukhi: ਜਯੋ ਜਾਮਦਗਨੰ ਦਿਜੰ ਅਾਵਤਾਰੀ || ਭਯੋ ਰੋਣਕਾ ਤੇ ਕਵਾਚੀ ਕੁਠਾਰੀ ||
transliteration: Jayo Jaamdagadan Dijan Aavtdaree|| Bhayo Renkaa Te Kavaachikouthdaree||
translation: Hail, hail to the incarnation-like sage Yamadagni, through whose wife Renuka was born the wearer of armour and carrier of axe (that is Parashurama);

gurmukhi: ਧਰਯੋ ਛਤ੍ਰੀਯਾਪਾਤ ਕੋ ਕਾਲ ਰੂਪੰ || ਹਨਯੋ ਜਾੲਿ ਜੳੁਨੇ ਸਹੰਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਭੂਪੰ ||੫||
transliteration: Ddaryo Chhatreeyaapaat Ko Kaal Roopan|| Hanyo Jaae Jaoune Sahansaastra Bhoopan||5||
translation: He manifested himself as death for the Kshatriyas and destroyed the king named Sahasrabadhu.5.

gurmukhi: ਕਹਾ ਗੰਮ ੲੇਤੀ ਕਥਾ ਸਰਬ ਭਾਖੳੁ || ਕਥਾ ਬ੍ਰਿੱਧ ਤੇ ਥੋਰੀਅੈ ਬਾਤ ਰਾਖੳੁ ||
transliteration: Kahaa Gadm Etikathaa Sarab Bhaakhau|| Kathaa Briddh Te Thoreeai Baat Raakhau||
translation: I have not the requisite wisdom to describe the whole story, therefore fearing lest it may not become voluminous, I say it very briefly:

gurmukhi: ਭਰੇ ਗਰਬ ਛੱਤ੍ਰੀ ਨਰੇਸੰ ਅਪਾਰੰ || ਤਿਨੈ ਨਾਸ ਕੋ ਪਾਣ ਧਾਰਯੋ ਕੁਠਾਰੰ ||੬||
transliteration: Bhare Gadab Chhatridaresaaag Apaaran|| Tinai Naas Ko Paan Dhdaryo Kouthaaran||6||
translation: The Kshatriya king had been intoxicated with pride and in order to destroy them, Parashurama held up the axe in his hand.6.
